Package it.unimol.monopoly.app

Class Prison

java.lang.Object
it.unimol.monopoly.app.Prison
public class Prison extends Object
Singleton that defines the Prison object. Prison is a place in which every player can randomly find themselves in throwing dice. In fact, the obtained number can directly take a player to prison, or to the "Transit" box, which takes them back to prison. Said object is composed of a private variable of Turn type, which constitutes the turn of the player who went to prison, and of an integer variable containing the value of the Exit Fee. Once in prison, it's only possible to leave or stay in.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Angelo Trotta

    • freeExit

      public void freeExit(Player player)
      It allows a free exit from prison, by setting the isPrisoner value of the Player instance to false.
      Parameters:
      player - The player currently in prison.

    • paidExit

      public boolean paidExit(Player player)
      It allows to leave prison by paying a tax, possible only if the money owned by the player is greater than the exit fee. If contrary to that, the player stays in prison.
      Parameters:
      player - The player currently in prison.
      Returns:
      true if the player left prison, false otherwise.

    • stay

      public void stay(Player player)
      It makes the player stay in prison, by ending their turn.
      Parameters:
      player - The player currently in prison.
